Understand customers and competitive contexts 1. Formulate and prioritize hypotheses 1. Design and create elegant solutions 1. R&R document.write('') # R&R ### Innovation and Entrepreneurship ### MBA 670 Marriott School of Business Brian P. Reschke Fall 2017 ## A perspective on entrepreneurship Entrepreneurship is the relentless pursuit of opportunity without regard to resources currently controlled. —Howard Stevenson ## R&R Case * Application of Porter's Five Forces * Illustration of 'Industry Immersion' approach to entrepreneurship Learning Outcome: Understand customers and competitive contexts ## R&R Case "

Creativity document.write('') # Creativity ### Innovation and Entrepreneurship ### MBA 670 Marriott School of Business Brian P. Reschke Fall 2017 ## Review: R&R Case * Application of Porter's Five Forces * Illustration of *'Industry Immersion'* approach to entrepreneurship * Distinctions: * Customer vs. User * Make vs. Buy (Network) * Product vs. Business Learning Outcome: Understand customers and competitive contexts ## R&R Case "

Status Quo document.write('') # Understanding and Challenging the Status Quo ### Entrepreneurial Innovation ### Bus M 470 Marriott School of Business Brian P. Reschke Fall 2017 ## Course Progress To-Date 1. Introduction to Three Arenas * Desirability, Feasibility, Viability 1. `Industry Immersion` Approach to Entrepreneurship * Bob Reiss and R&R 1. Introduction to `Domain Search` and Creativity * Piero Presentation * Bolster Creative Confidence 1. `Divergence-Convergence`, Team Formation ## Up-and-Coming 1.

8470-Lecture-6-emberjs: Slides Introduction to Ember and handlebars Secure Web Application Development Dr. Hale University of Nebraska at Omaha CYBR 8470 - Lecture 6 become a javascript Today: Ember.JS and Handlebars Part 1: Client-side App Frameworks Part 2: Ember.js What is Ember.js? Where does it sit in the server stack? Ember bindings (HEAVEN) Handlebars Syntax Integrating 3rd Party jQuery Libraries Using Ember tools Integrating with a server-side API Part1: Client-side Apps Why clientside App Frameworks?
